element.name: Covo Loco #0035 by Flidais und die eichhoernchen, Traditional Cache (1/1.5)
element.long-description:
The idea behind the COVO LOCOs All nice places in your region are already full of caches? You've already found all the caches near your home? You're not in the mood to go far from your home to find a cache but you're missing the sensation of the hunt? Then this is the solution: the COVO LOCO - a series of caches in the stile of a chain letter! Who finds a COVO LOCO can hide a new one!
The Statutes
§1: The type of a COVO LOCO is always "traditional"!
§2: COVO LOCOs have to be easily accessable by car! Avoid long walks on foot!
§3: Every listing of a COVO LOCO has to have a very clear hint!
§4: The caches have to be named like "COVO LOCO #(number of four digits)"! In this way they can be distinguished from caches made with love in nice places.
§5: The numbers of the COVO LOCO range from #0001 to #9999! Prior to the publication of a new COVO LOCO you need to register your favoured number at www.covoloco.eu!
§6: The listing of a new COVO LOCO has to contain these statutes!
§7: Every finder of a COVO LOCO can place a new COVO LOCO himself -
violation of this will be punished with 5 DNFs in a line by the Lord of the Caches! *ggg*
Go to Covo Loco
IMPORTANT!!! §7 it is purely voluntary and should not be considered an Additional Logging Requirement, nobody has to hide a cache to claim this find.
" Maintenance for this cache will be provided by a local cacher their details are on file with Geocaching"

ul.li:
2010-06-01T19:00:00Z : Found it by anice77
2010-06-01 10:20 Uhr Found this cache at my vacation and caching trip in Irland. [b]Thx a lot for this cool location.Thanks for this cache which is my find [red]#2719#[/red] anice77

2010-05-26T19:00:00Z : Found it by tmob
#2431
We looked for this cache during our holidays in Ireland. Six fantastic days, 1800kms driven, and a bunch of caches found. Definitely a great way to get to know this beautiful island!
Just a formality, cause we were here for the europe's first [:D] Nevertheless, it's a nice place, nice view, and the star of great trail near the ocean.
Thanks for this one... Greetings from Portugal

2010-05-26T19:00:00Z : Found it by Tranicka
Our last Irish cache, thanks :-)

2010-05-21T19:00:00Z : Found it by Numira
Our first geocache in Ireland. We enjoyed the view of Bray very much! Thank for the cache! Greetings from the Czech republic!

wpt.name: GC1Z0Q0
wpt.desc: Covo Loco #0035 by Flidais und die eichhoernchen, Traditional Cache (1/1.5)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Covo Loco #0035
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
The idea behind the COVO LOCOs

All nice places in your region are already full of caches? You've already found all the caches near your home? You're not in the mood to go far from your home to find a cache but you're missing the sensation of the hunt? Then this is the solution: the COVO LOCO - a series of caches in the stile of a chain letter! Who finds a COVO LOCO can hide a new one!

The Statutes


§1: The type of a COVO LOCO is always "traditional"!

§2: COVO LOCOs have to be easily accessable by car! Avoid long walks on foot!

§3: Every listing of a COVO LOCO has to have a very clear hint!

§4: The caches have to be named like "COVO LOCO #(number of four digits)"! In this way they can be distinguished from caches made with love in nice places.

§5: The numbers of the COVO LOCO range from #0001 to #9999! Prior to the publication of a new COVO LOCO you need to register your favoured number at www.covoloco.eu!

§6: The listing of a new COVO LOCO has to contain these statutes!

§7: Every finder of a COVO LOCO can place a new COVO LOCO himself -
violation of this will be punished with 5 DNFs in a line by the Lord of the Caches! *ggg*

Go to Covo Loco


IMPORTANT!!! §7 it is purely voluntary and should not be considered an Additional Logging Requirement, nobody has to hide a cache to claim this find.

" Maintenance for this cache will be provided by a local cacher their details are on file with Geocaching"
